ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Functional hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant inconsistencies between voluntary thresholds (mixed loss) and objective measures (Type A tympanograms, present acoustic reflexes); poor agreement between SRT and PTA in the right ear.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To inspect the external ear canal and tympanic membrane.
To assess speech reception and recognition abilities.
To assess the acoustic reflex arc and cross-check behavioral thresholds.
To check for non-organic unilateral hearing loss.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a voluntary audiogram suggesting unilateral moderately severe mixed hearing loss in the left ear. However, significant internal inconsistencies suggest functional (non-organic) hearing loss. Specifically, the presence of normal ipsilateral acoustic reflexes and Type A tympanograms in the left ear contradicts the voluntary display of a mixed loss with a conductive component. Additionally, the Right Ear SRT is elevated relative to the pure-tone average.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight hearing loss at 250 Hz and 3000-8000 Hz; normal at 500-2000 Hz. Left ear: Moderately severe mixed hearing loss (flat configuration approx 60-70 dB HL) with air-bone gap (approx 40-45 dB HL), but validity is questionable.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear SRT (26 dB HL) elevated compared to PTA (poor agreement); WRS 80% at 66 dB HL. Left ear SRT (56 dB HL) agrees with voluntary PTA but WRS is very poor (26-28% at 92 dB HL).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal middle ear function bilaterally (Type A), which contradicts the air-bone gap seen in the Left Ear pure-tone thresholds.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal ipsilateral reflexes present at 500-1000 Hz bilaterally (RE 95/90 dB, LE 85/85 dB). Presence in LE is inconsistent with the degree of mixed/conductive loss presented on the audiogram.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: ASSR test results indicated hearing to be within normal limits in the right ear and a mild to moderate hearing loss in the left ear at 250 to 2000 Hz. ABR waveforms were established with Wave V peaks identified at 40 dB nHL bilaterally, indicating no more than a mild hearing loss in either ear between 2000 and 4000 Hz. The patient was counseled regarding the results and that a functional hearing loss was suspected. The patient was referred for a repeat audiogram.

tests.name: Auditory Steady-State Response (ASSR)
tests.result_summary: Right ear within normal limits. Left ear mild to moderate hearing loss at 250-2000 Hz.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Wave V peaks identified at 40 dB nHL bilaterally, indicating no more than mild hearing loss between 2000-4000 Hz.

proposed_items: Referral for electrophysiological testing (ABR and ASSR)
counseling_actions: Reinstruct on test procedures to ensure understanding
Counsel regarding suspicion of functional hearing loss

escalation.rationale_short: To estimate organic hearing sensitivity due to unreliable behavioral results.

follow_up_plan.objective: Obtain objective thresholds via ABR/ASSR and repeat behavioral testing.
